commit.title: DL-49: Support building project with scala 2.10 and 2.11
The CONFIG.ini file has no purpose outside of Twitter
Build cobertura report only on master for successful builds
Fix the typo in merge script on formatting modified title
DL-59: Check findbugs warning before packaging
DL-60: Add user mail list to the community page
DL-56: Fix broken links in quickstart page
Add instructions for building website and documentation
DL-52: update README.md to reflect current status of the project
[BLOG] A technical review of kafka and distributedlog
DL-3: Move distributedlog website to apache
Add infinite retry policy to zookeeper client used by tests
DL-29: The merge PR script should delete branches once the PR are merged
DL-50: Add coveralls plugin to the build and enable it on github page
DL-39: Use a distributedlog uri to configure write proxy routing address
Mark some dl tests as flaky
DL-36: travis ci build failed with assembly plugin
DL-31: Provide flag to disable zk based distributed lock
DL-1: Clean up the distributedlog pom files
DL-25: Documentation for vagrant and docker deployment
DL-21: Fix DL flaky test cases
DL-16: Use correct git remote repository
DL-20: Validate bk read timeout in configuration
DL-16: Add script to merge GitHub PR.
Starting write proxy and bookies depending on environment variables.
Vagrant based solution to create multi-node deployment (#34)
Updated to the public version of twitter bookkeeper
Creating a docker file which calls into the vagrant bookkeeper script
Updated with comments on the pull request
Got it working for proxy and normal writes
wrongly use LastAddConfirmed as LastAddPushed in picture lacprotocol.png (#30)
Added vagrant files to start 3 ZK nodes and 3 BK nodes with writeproxy
Add documents on running distributedlog in distributed mode
use dlog-daemon.sh to start writeproxy, use the newly created my_namespace to write logs. (#22)
Fixes #14: remove concurrency from ConfigurationSubscription tests (#16)
Add Contact, Authors sections to README.
Fix typo in quick start page (#9)
Create a release script to create binary packages
